page.title: 15DARTFORD - SUBSIDENCE
page.content: In parts of Dartford there is a serious problem of subsidence. When a family tried to buy a house in Brent Lane they found that none of the Building Societies would grant them a mortgage because the foundations of the house are slipping down the hill, and on a hot summers day you can hear the foundations cracking. A house built in 1934 on Shepherds Lane had to be demolished and rebuilt because it had been built on the site of an old sand pit. Although the hole had been filled with a mixture of ash and clinker, this was washed away when the drains of the house cracked. It was cheaper to demolish the house than to try to underpin the foundations. The cost was kept down by saving the roof tiles,bath room and kitchen fittings and replacing them in the new house.
